column4: I bought a 22" widescreen LCD (AL2216W). Ubuntu was stretched, so I ran dpkg-reconfigure on xorg. However, the refresh time is REALLY slow. I see a line come down the screen as it refreshes. Why? (PS: ATI video card, Windows works fine)
I am using default, I believe FGLRX -- that's ATI proprietary, isn't it?
that is not default but yes proprietary
So is there anything I can do?
Oh, they aren't working at all. I believe it auto turned off...
Is there anything I can do? :\
-> ii  xserver-xgl                                1:1.1.99.1~git20070727-0ubuntu3 -- Should I do an apt-get remove ?
so it's installed and runs on X startup
So it looks fine now. Basically, no more XGL or Compiz-Fusion for me?
if it solved it: sorry, yes. until ati gets their acto together, if ever
